summary: Millions of Americans had trouble paying their rent or mortgages after the COVID-19 pandemic disrupted the U.S. economy. The CARES Act appropriated $12.4 billion to the Department of Housing and Urban Development to help address emergent needs. For example, funding increased more than tenfold for homelessness assistance under an emergency grant program. HUD expedited program risk assessments due to the urgency of its pandemic response...
title: COVID-19: Additional Risk Assessment Actions Could Improve HUD Oversight of CARES Act Funds
